page.title: 14COMMUNICATIONS AND TRANSPORT
page.content: There is a Post Office at Wearhead but no longer at Ireshopeburn, pensioners there having to travel to Wearhead or St.John's Chapel. Postal deliveries vary from 6.45a.m. to afternoon, dep- ending on the van's route. Most houses have a private telephone, though some still share a party line. There are public kiosks at Wearhead and Ireshopeburn that work most of the time. Most families have a car but there is a good reliable bus service which makes the return journey from Stanhope to Cowshill 10 times a day. On Wednesdays and Saturdays special buses run direct from Stanhope to Newcastle. Pensioners are issued with bus tokens,at present worth Â£15 a year. Fares are cheap compared with some other areas. The railway line was closed in 1953 and the nearest stat- ions are Bishop Auckland and Durham.
